answer:
For most people, hepatitis A vaccine is given as two doses, six months apart. Learn more about the disease and vaccine here. The Hepatitis A vaccine is publicly funded (free) for some individuals in BC. If your child is eligible for the vaccine for free, you can book a vaccine appointment for the second dose at your local health unit. Our health unit finder is here.
Anyone who is not eligible for a free hepatitis A vaccine can purchase it at most pharmacies and travel clinics.
Immunization Nurse
answer_formatted:
## For most people, hepatitis A vaccine is given as two doses, six months apart.

Learn more about the disease and vaccine here.

## The Hepatitis A vaccine is publicly funded (free) for some individuals in BC.

If your child is eligible for the vaccine for free, you can book a vaccine appointment for the second dose at your local health unit.
Our health unit finder is here.
Anyone who is not eligible for a free hepatitis A vaccine can purchase it at most pharmacies and travel clinics.

## Immunization Nurse
question: What to do if the second booster of Hepatitis a booster is missed for a child?
question_variation_0: booster missed when booster is missed for kids
question_variation_1: booster booster hepatitis missed for a child
